name: Safe Steps Housing Support
description: Safe Steps helps young adults who have been in foster care find and keep safe, stable housing in the study county.
eligibility_summary: Young adults ages 18–24 who live in the study county and have a history in foster care.
eligibility_details: Open to foster-care alumni ages 18–24 living in the study county. Income and housing situation are reviewed during intake. You do not need perfect documents to start the conversation.

cost.details: Free for eligible participants. Some rental funds go directly to landlords.

documentation_required: Proof of prior foster-care involvement (if available)
Basic proof of income or benefits (can discuss options)
notes_for_providers: Best fit for youth with some income who can take over rent within 6–12 months.

name: LaunchPad Job & Career Center
description: LaunchPad helps young adults build resumes, practice interviews, and connect with starter jobs that pay at least local minimum wage.
eligibility_summary: Ages 18–30 living in the study county. Open to all work backgrounds.
eligibility_details: Open to young adults ages 18–30 who live in the study county. No income limit. Some training programs may have their own requirements.

cost.details: Free for job seekers. Some certification programs may have separate fees.

documentation_required: Resume (they can help you create one if you do not have one)
accessibility_features: Computer lab with screen readers installed
notes_for_providers: Can support participants who have gaps in employment or justice involvement; staff are trained in trauma-informed approaches.

name: Guardian Scholars College Support
description: Guardian Scholars offers coaching and financial aid guidance for students who have been in foster care and are enrolled at the community college.
services_offered: Help with FAFSA and financial aid appeals
Connections to campus housing and food pantry
eligibility_summary: Current or incoming students at the community college with a history of foster care.
eligibility_details: Participants must be admitted or enrolled at the Study County Community College and have a history of foster care, kinship care, or adoption from foster care. Documentation can often be coordinated with the financial aid office.

cost.details: Program services are free. Students remain responsible for tuition and fees not covered by aid.

documentation_required: Foster-care verification (financial aid office can assist if you are unsure)
accessibility_features: Virtual appointments by phone or video
notes_for_providers: Great referral for youth already interested in college or currently enrolled.

name: Calm Bridge Counseling Center
description: Calm Bridge provides HIPAA-compliant, trauma-informed counseling for young adults, including virtual visits.
eligibility_summary: Ages 18–29 in the study county. Insurance, Medicaid, or sliding scale.
eligibility_details: Serves young adults ages 18–29 who live in the study county. Accepts Medicaid, some private insurance, and offers a sliding scale for those without coverage.

cost.details: Accepts Medicaid and some private insurance. Sliding scale options available; no one turned away for first screening call.

documentation_required: Insurance card or Medicaid number (if you have one)
notes_for_providers: Not a crisis center; best for scheduled counseling. For same-day crisis mental health support, use 988 or local mobile crisis lines.

name: Youth Legal Pathways Clinic
description: Youth Legal Pathways offers free legal help with ID documents, record sealing, and housing or employment-related legal questions.
services_offered: Help getting state ID and vital records
eligibility_summary: Ages 18–26 with low or no income in the study county.
eligibility_details: Serves young adults ages 18–26 with low or no income who live or work in the study county. Some cases may be referred out depending on complexity.

cost.details: Legal advice and brief services are free. Court filing fees may apply but can sometimes be waived.

documentation_required: Any court papers you have (if available)
Any letters you have received about your case
accessibility_features: ASL interpreter available with advance notice
notes_for_providers: Great option when ID or records issues are blocking housing or employment.

name: Study County 211 Helpline
description: Call 211 anytime to talk with someone about local resources, including food, shelter, mental health, and more.
eligibility_summary: Open to anyone in the study county.
eligibility_details: Available 24/7 by phone, text, or web chat. You do not need to share your name.

cost.details: Free from most phones. Some cell providers may treat 211 as a local call.

accessibility_features: Phone, text, and web chat options
notes_for_providers: A good starting point when youth or families are unsure where to begin.
